intro: Podolepis aristata var. chrysantha, commonly known as the goldenpod lewisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
